summary: This is a press release from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York announcing the arrest and indictment of Jeffrey Epstein on charges of sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy to commit sex trafficking of minors. The release details allegations of abuse from 2002-2005 involving dozens of underage girls in New York and Florida, facilitated by a network of employees and victim-recruiters.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Charged with sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy. Allegedly sexually exploited dozens of underage girls between 2002-2005 in New York and Florida, using a network of employees and victim-recruiters.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Issued the press release announcing the charges against Epstein and made a statement condemning the alleged abuse and affirming the office's commitment to the victims.

persons.name: Henry B. Pitman
persons.context: Expected to preside over Epstein's initial court presentation in Manhattan federal court.

persons.name: Richard M. Berman
persons.context: Assigned to oversee the case against Jeffrey Epstein.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is the lead prosecutor announcing the indictment and charges against Epstein.
The indictment alleges Epstein worked with employees and associates to contact victims, schedule encounters, and facilitate his abuse.
Epstein is accused of sexually exploiting and abusing dozens of underage girls, paying them cash, and using some to recruit others.
The indictment describes a scheme where certain victims were paid to recruit additional underage girls for Epstein to abuse.

events.title: Arrest of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested on Saturday on charges of sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy.

events.title: Indictment Unsealed
events.description: The indictment charging Jeffrey Epstein with sex trafficking and conspiracy was unsealed in Manhattan federal court.

events.title: Alleged Abuse Period
events.description: The period during which Epstein allegedly sexually exploited and abused dozens of underage girls in New York and Florida.

events.title: Expected Court Presentation
events.description: Epstein was expected to be presented in Manhattan federal court before U.S. Magistrate Judge Henry B. Pitman.

locations: New York, New York (specifically his mansion/residence on the Upper East Side)
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was arrested and charged with sex trafficking of minors and conspiracy to commit sex trafficking of minors.
The alleged criminal conduct occurred from at least 2002 through 2005, involving dozens of underage victims as young as 14.
Epstein allegedly operated a scheme where he paid victims to recruit other underage girls, creating a vast network for exploitation.
The abuse allegedly took place at Epstein's residences in New York City and Palm Beach, Florida, under the guise of 'massages' that escalated to sex acts.
The indictment alleges Epstein worked with employees and associates to facilitate the abuse by contacting victims and scheduling encounters.
